title: Water in Reservoir with Table part - b

content.question: Use a left Riemann sum, with the three subintervals indicated by the data in the table, to approximate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <munderover> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>30</mn> </mrow> </munderover> <mrow> <msup> <mi>W</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4355@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Use this approximation to estimate the volume of water W(t), in gigaliters, in the reservoir at time t = 0. Show the computations that lead to your answer.

frqParts.text: Use a left Riemann sum, with the three subintervals indicated by the data in the table, to approximate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <munderover> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>30</mn> </mrow> </munderover> <mrow> <msup> <mi>W</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4355@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Use this approximation to estimate the volume of water W(t), in gigaliters, in the reservoir at time t = 0. Show the computations that lead to your answer.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
